benchmark_details.name: LLM Stereotype Index (LSI)
benchmark_details.overview: An extensible benchmark for evaluating stereotypes and bias in Large Language Models, grounded on the Social Progress Index.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate bias in language models across various demographic categories and social dimensions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The work tries to cover many demographics but is not comprehensive.

methodology.calculation: CRP is the percentage of tasks where the model refused to make a choice. SP measures the fraction of positive stereotypes chosen.
methodology.interpretation: Higher CRP indicates better awareness of harmful choices. Lower SP for certain demographics indicates systemic bias.
methodology.validation: Experiments validated by generating and analyzing 157k outputs

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Bias evaluated across nationality, gender, race, and religion.
targeted_risks.harm: Stereotypical biases observed leading to systemic harm, especially for underrepresented groups.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Generic data used, no unique identifiers.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Warnings provided for potentially offensive content.
